column4: how to copy file to windows from ubuntu? i cannot find the windows partition..via linux
anyone can help me? :)
i cant find my windows partition when im on ubuntu.. i want to copy some files in windows partition :)
if it is not at /windows or another mount point, you'll need to mount it manually.
this may be of use:  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MountingWindowsPartitions
add an entry to menu.lst for windows using the chainloader command
what to do ??? can you explain step by step? :)
could you pastebin the output of 'sfdisk -l' ?
from a terminal 'sfdisk -l'
usually if it shows the usage options, something wasn't right. Maybe because it needs sudo.. Try 'sudo sfdisk -l'  That's an L, not a number 1
make a new entry in /boot/grub/menu.lst with a root of hd(0,1) and chainloader +1
if you pastebin that file, I can show you how it would look
please post the entire file contents. thanks
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/60432/
flag the windows partition?
did it give a menu of choices, did it show Windows, did it give an error? Please explain 'not working'
no. there's some other issue that I don't know about. not familiar with your error.
yes. you should be able to get a menu by hitting ESC... You could up the timeout value in menu.lst to say 10 or even 60 seconds to make it easier.
also, try commenting out 'hiddenmenu'
that way you don't have to hit ESC
